JsonData.Context: You discover a new energy source.
JsonData.Option1Description: **Further elaboration on option visible upon hover**
JsonData.Option1Impact: **Describe what you want to happen after option1 is chosen here.**
JsonData.Option2Description: **Further elaboration on option**
JsonData.Option2Impact: **Describe what you want to happen after option2 is chosen here.**

JsonData.Context:
2025: You are the newly elected president of the United States. 
The worsening climate crisis is looming in your mind.
Every year, hurricanes, droughts, and flooding worsens.
You must phase out fossil fuel use as soon as possible
in order to mitigate the effects of Climate Change.
Your advisors have briefed you on a climate action bill passed
by Congress, calling for complete decarbonization of the electricity grid.
It is up to you to determine how the nation shall proceed.
JsonData.Option1Text: Promote Renewable Energy sources and Next-generation Nuclear Energy
JsonData.Option1Description:
Renewables are seen as the best path forward, delivering continuous energy for years after installation, at the cost of no carbon emissions. However, the electric grid requires massive amounts of electricity, and
there are doubts if a reliable grid can be run with only renewable energy.
Nuclear energy is reliable, releases zero-carbon, and currently provides
about 20% of American electricity.
This bill will construct more renewable energy, maintain current nuclear installations, and provide funding to construct safer and more efficient Next-generation Fission Nuclear
Power plants, as well as fund Fusion Research.
JsonData.Option1Impact: We GOING ECO!
JsonData.Option2Description:
This bill would completely champion renewable energy sources, calling for the end to all fossil fuel and nuclear electricity sources. This is a popular stance among climate activists, however there are
doubts that Renewables could provide enough electricity to power
the entire power grid in time to mitigate the climate crisis. 
In addition, renewable can be unreliable, as solar is not operational 
at night and wind when the air is tranquil.
Nuclear energy currently provides 20% of American Electricity, and demolishing those events this soon would force the use of fossil fuels in order to fill that gap in production.
JsonData.Option2Impact: More power?

JsonData.Context:
You have decided to promote renewable energy sources and next-generation nuclear energy. 
Now, you must decide on specific measures to incentivize and accelerate the adoption of these technologies.
JsonData.Option1Text: Offer tax breaks for renewable energy and nuclear projects.
JsonData.Option1Description: Americans hate taxes so they will do anything in their power to write them off.
JsonData.Option1Impact: A bunch of fraud companies claiming to be renewable appear.
JsonData.Option2Text: Fund research for renewable energy and nuclear advancements.
JsonData.Option2Description: Where are we going to get the funding?
JsonData.Option2Impact: Congress denied your program due to "budget" concerns and told you to try again. Maybe when your party has a supermajority.

JsonData.Context:
Every company is claiming to be renewable for your tax breaks. 
Even oil companies claim to be "renewable" now. 
What's your next move?"
JsonData.Option1Text: Create a certification program to verify authenticity.
JsonData.Option1Description: Who will be in charge of the certification program? Wait! What about my nephew?
JsonData.Option1Impact: Your advisor's nephew is leading the certification program.
JsonData.Option2Description:
They can't all be lying, right? Sacrifices must be made for renewable energy. 
Only with money can technology advance.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
Oil companies flourished. 
Renewable companies flourished. 
And the government ran out of money.
Your nuclear program was canceled, and fossil fuels continued to thrive. 
 The world ended 20 years due to global warming.

JsonData.Context:
All the big oil companies are getting the certificate and reaping tax benefits. 
Your advisor's nephew just bought a new car.
How will you proceed.
JsonData.Option1Text: Fire your advisor's nephew and appoint a renowned scientist.
JsonData.Option1Description: With all due discretion, I heavily advise against taking such a hasty action.
JsonData.Option1Impact: The nephew was fired, and a competent head has taken the lead.
JsonData.Option2Text: Fire your advisor's nephew and appoint the other's advisor nephew.
JsonData.Option2Description: My nephew is better.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
You replace one nephew with another.
Nothing has changed...

JsonData.Context:
Money is running out. Fossil fuels are more popular than ever.
The press is urging you to do something about this.
JsonData.Option1Description:
Ignore the press. 
They do not know what they are talking about.
JsonData.Option1Impact: What did you expect? We all die from global warming.
JsonData.Option2Description: Not my nephew!
JsonData.Option2Impact:
You pretend that fiasco never happened.
You cancel the program and start anew.

JsonData.Context:
Certificates are being passed out responsibly. 
Nuclear energy companies are booming.
A scientist approaches you about a new technology called fusion.
JsonData.Option1Description:
Nuclear fusion is the stuff in fiction. Impractical.
Focus on fission and solar/wind energy sources.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
More wind turbines and solar panels populate the world.
The number of nuclear fission reactors quintuple.
JsonData.Option2Description:
Fusion has the potential to generate a lot of energy!
Do it.
JsonData.Option2Impact: You begin funding. Progress is slow.

JsonData.Context:
The same scientist reports that we are running out of space for wind and solar panels.
The efficiency is too low. People are complaining about the loud turbines.
They recommend fusion again.

Another scientist says its fine. We just need to reduce our energy consumption.
What shall we do?
JsonData.Option1Description: We are on the right track. Stay focused and continue for a more eco future!
JsonData.Option1Impact: More wind turbines and solar panels populate the world.
JsonData.Option2Description:
Fusion has the potential to generate a lot of energy!
Do it.
JsonData.Option2Impact: You begin funding. Progress is slow.

JsonData.Context:
We are 100% renewable! 
However, energy is expensive and the cost of living has soared.
Some people are mad and are lobbying to remove you.
JsonData.Option1Description: Sometimes the tough decision is the right one.
JsonData.Option1Impact: No one is lobbying to remove you.
JsonData.Option2Description: If we improve renewable energy efficiency, energy should be cheaper.
JsonData.Option2Impact: Scientists find no obvious solution. You continue to fund.

JsonData.Context:
People are trying to leave the country due to cost of living.
We are losing population. Costs rack up.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
The people have had enough!
They start another rebellion and overthrow you.
The symbol of the wind turbine has become a symbol of evil.
They tear down all the renewable energy sources.
Gas for all!
The world ends from global warming 20 years later.
JsonData.Option2Description: If we improve renewable energy efficiency, energy should be cheaper.
JsonData.Option2Impact: Scientists find no obvious solution. You continue to fund.

JsonData.Context:
Scientists struggle to improve efficiency of renewable energy. The people are very unhappy.
What should we do?
JsonData.Option1Impact: Solar panel efficiency improved by 30%! Energy cost greatly reduces.
JsonData.Option2Description:
Fusion has the potential to generate a lot of energy!
Do it.
JsonData.Option2Impact: You begin funding. Progress is slow.

JsonData.Context:
The future looks bright. The same fusion scientist approaches once again.
They insist there is a cap on renewable energy and the only way to progress is fusion.
Cost of living is still a great burden on your people.
JsonData.Option1Description: We already got this far. Believe in our path.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
A 18 year-old scientist Bisac Bewton discovered a 99% efficiency renewable energy source.
The world is saved from global warming!
JsonData.Option2Description:
Fusion has the potential to generate a lot of energy!
Do it.
JsonData.Option2Impact: You begin funding. Progress is slow.

JsonData.Context:
Fusion seems to be going nowhere. 
Their biggest accomplishment was generating enough energy to heat up a bathtub. 
Is this really the right choice?
JsonData.Option1Description:
I am good friends with the lead-nuclear fusion scientist. 
I recommend to continue funding.
JsonData.Option1Impact: Congress is questioning your actions.
JsonData.Option2Text: Cancel the fusion plan and rethink your decision.
JsonData.Option2Description: This was a bad idea to begin with.
JsonData.Option2Impact: The people are unhappy at this indecisive leader.

JsonData.Context:
Fusion seems to be going nowhere. 
Their biggest accomplishment was generating enough energy to heat up a two bathtubs. 
Still the right choice?
JsonData.Option1Description: If we extrapolate, we'll be able to heat up 3 bathtubs soon!
JsonData.Option1Impact: Congress is questioning your actions.
JsonData.Option2Text: Cancel the fusion plan and rethink your decision.
JsonData.Option2Description: This was a bad idea to begin with.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
Fusion scientists are mad at you for suddenly canceling funding.
They team up with fossil fuels to overthrow you.
The world ends from global warming 20 years later.

JsonData.Context:
Government shutdown! The first thing to go was funding for nuclear fusion. 
What should we do?
JsonData.Option1Text: Beg for fusion to continue to be funded.
JsonData.Option1Impact: After six months of debate, Congress begrudgingly accepts.
JsonData.Option2Text: Cancel the fusion plan and rethink your decision.
JsonData.Option2Description: Fusion lacks potential to energy. We already invested enough.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
Fusion scientists are mad at you for suddenly canceling funding.
They team up with fossil fuels to overthrow you.
The world ends from global warming 20 years later.

JsonData.Context:
SpaceX developed a spaceship that can go to Mars. Elon said he'll colonize the planet and he wants our support.
What should we do?
JsonData.Option1Description: Space has much more potential than that fusion nonsense.
JsonData.Option1Impact: Humanity arrives on Mars.
JsonData.Option2Description: Are we really going to give up on fusion?
JsonData.Option2Impact: A big breakthrough has been made! Unlimited energy!

JsonData.Context:
The Pentagon has warned that fusion is too dangerous to be public.
They propose to keep it a secret. Do you agree?
JsonData.Option1Description: Imagine the atrocities that will happen if this falls into the wrong hands.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
The US hides the secret of fusion.
A Russian spy leaks the secret anyway.
This scandal forces you to resign.
Fusion technology flourishes.
Fossil fuels are completely phased out, and the climate crisis is averted.
This scandal forces you to resign.
But, at least the world is saved?
JsonData.Option2Description: The public deserves to know!
JsonData.Option2Impact:
You make a public statement about fusion.
The Pentagon is angry. 
One scientist began calling himself the destroyer of worlds
and began destroying research related to fusion.

JsonData.Context: Is this technology really that dangerous? Maybe, humanity is better off not having it...
JsonData.Option1Text: Destroy all research made in fusion.
JsonData.Option1Description: It's for the best. The power of unlimited energy is too great.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
We'll never know if you fully destroyed the secret of fusion.
You did set back technology by 20 years though.
During that time, the world ends due to global warming.
JsonData.Option2Description: Do not stop human advancements.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
The world may end...
but it probably won't be due to global warming.
Yay!

JsonData.Context:
A garbage man proposes to dump garbage on Mars. A colonizer proposes to colonize Mars.
What will you choose?
JsonData.Option1Description:
Mars is a bunch of useless space rocks anyway. 
Let's dump our trash.
JsonData.Option1Impact:
The Earth gets cleaner and
hotter.
The world ends due to global warming.
JsonData.Option2Description: Space travel!
JsonData.Option2Impact:
Sadly, we did not have technology to sustain in Mars. If only we had a better energy source...
Meanwhile, Earth ends from global warming.

JsonData.Context:
Nuclear bad! Only renewable energy! 
What measures do you take to promote this stance?
JsonData.Option1Impact:
While shutting down a power plant, it explodes.
Killing you.
Fossil fuels continue to thrive.
20 years later, the world ends from global warming.
JsonData.Option2Text: Make laws to restrict fossil fuels.
JsonData.Option2Description: Phase out fossil fuels. Gain renewable energy.
JsonData.Option2Impact:
Congress (oil companies) say nope. 
Maybe rethink your direction.

JsonData.Context: Bad Ending.
Good Ending.
